intro: Colpodium ponticum, commonly known as the Pontic bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibacillaceae. It is characterized by its tiny, bladder-like structures called bladders, which are used to trap small aquatic organisms. The plant typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds and slow-moving streams. Its leaves are slender and often form dense mats on the water surface. Colpodium ponticum plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and contributing to nutrient cycling.
